top_categories.workout_context: BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah)’s utah red rock gravel (70%), paved roads (30%) demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah) isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
At 84 miles, BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah) punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah) rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah) when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah)’s utah red rock—high desert technical terrain and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah). Make this intensity feel like home.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah) — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah)’s 9,843ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Every session at BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah) intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.

Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah) — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on utah red rock—high desert technical terrain.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah)’s 9,843ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

race_overlay.heat: May in Cedar City, Utah can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah). Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah)’s 84 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah). Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at BWR Utah (Belgian Waffle Ride Utah) demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride utah red rock—high desert technical terrain at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: utah red rock gravel (70%), paved roads (30%), high desert. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 84 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and Durability to prepare you for 84 miles of utah red rock—high desert technical terrain in Cedar City, Utah.
